Kronos deployment tomorrow - complete all contracts!

From: Ari Kes

Sent: 2014.06.02 07:12

To: Red Frog Freight,

Hello Pilots

EVE Online: Kronos will be deployed on 3 June!

Downtime for the deployment of this release will begin at the usual time of 11:00 UTC, and will be completed by 14:00 UTC.

Please, ensure that you complete your contracts before downtime on the 3rd June and be careful not to accept any contracts shortly before it. If all goes as planned it will only take up to three hours, but given previous experiences, you never know.

Fly safe,

Ari Kes

Director

Red Frog Freight

Sending mail out to people in a game called EVE Online

Seeing a spacesuited astronaut standing on a platform on the end of the robot arm in space is a crystal-clear sign we live in the future.

You can't fix Stupid with Duct tape

number = 78

guess = 0

while guess != number:

guess = input("Guess a number: ")

if guess > number:

print "Too high"

elif guess < number:

print "Too low"

print "Just right"

Yep, got another video set up ^^

Virtual Reality is one of the upcoming technologies of the near future, with many speculating its mass availability by the year 2017. With multiple giants of the computer industry throwing their efforts behind it, it seeks to become one of the most game-changing technologies of the 21st century, from Sony with Project Morpheus and Facebook with Oculus, the market is ripe for innovation. However, concerns are ripe over the onset of the technology, with many critics claiming that it could be abused as training grounds for mass murder, that it could inspire crime - a theory that is disputable to this day. According to several researchers, violent crime could be reduced since the players are too busy venting their anger on their games toward polygons and pixels than to vent their anger violently on the streets toward real victims. National FBI records on violent crime seem to support this idea, with notable declines in crime from the mid 1990's, when video games started to gain mass popularity with the debut of legendary titles such as Wolfenstein. Other controversies plague the technology as well. Many point out that the simulation of actions such as *** or an more stimulating environment can cause addiction or physiological issues in users; a case that has been mirrored in video games. Throughout human history, technology has been scapegoated. Sometimes they deserved it, sometimes they didn't, but one thing is clear. Virtual reality is inevitable, it will come, and whether the effects will be positive or negative, only time can tell.
